description: Students learn mathematical topics that form an essential background for the study of computer science, including basic logic, predicate calculus and formal reasoning, verification of programs, direct proofs, mathematical induction, indirect proofs, properties of number systems, functions, quantifiers. Prerequisites: Computer Science 121 or 225 or permission of instructor. Students with especially weak or especially strong mathematics backgrounds should consult with the program director. Offered annually in the Spring Semester.
name: Math Found Computing
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Computer Science 121 or 225 or permission of instructor. Students with especially weak or especially strong mathematics backgrounds should consult with the program director. Offered annually in the Spring Semester.
title: Mathematical Foundations of Computing
